title: Question for Kindlejack, if he sees this
body:
I'm pretty excited for the new Fiddle sticks VGU. I have just finished playing the new Resident Evil 2 remake, and I don't think I was ever more scared in a video game than when Mr. X surprised me as he came stomping after me in a Licker filled hallway. This isn't related to League, but I just wanted to demonstrate a moment where in a video game I actually felt the Fight or Flight responses IRL.

My question: what kind of horror theme are you channeling into new Fiddlesticks? Jump scares? Ambient fear? Unstoppable horror (like Mr. X)?  I know you probably can't wait to show us, and we can't wait to see it... but I was hoping for maybe a small hint.

I'm really excited to play him, I enjoy playing champions that put "fear" into enemy players without actually using a fear mechanic. Warwick's ambient music chiming on when an enemy champion is below 50% HP, I friggin love that. You can sometimes see the apprehension in players when that dings on. I'm hoping Fiddlesticks is similar or better.

replies.body:
Squad5 is targeting Fiddle's gameplay around being 'The premier ambush champion in LoL' which as I understand it means that, all other things being equal, it should win in situations where it gets the drop on opponents. The balance to this is if opponents know where Fiddlesticks is and jump on it then Fiddle is gonna go down like a straw man. Due to this core gameplay value it totally makes sense for Fiddlesticks to be, well, fear itself! The horror trope of fear incarnate: it grows stronger the more you run from it and the more frightened you get, and the only way to defeat it is to face it with a fearless heart.

Mr. X is gonna kill you. He's an unstoppable threat and you can _only_ run from him. Another example of this used well in games is The Hunter in Dead Space (my personal favourite horror game) where you are forced to perform high-skill tasks while the ever present threat is constantly closing in on you. It's the stress of a deadline, the knowledge of our inevitable death, the shock of thinking you had   more      time          ,

Fiddlesticks is the unknown. It's the open back door you're swear you locked, it's the darkness beyond the last lamp on the street, it's the sound of footsteps when you know you are alone. If you can somehow quell that fear and stop your imagination running wild with images of Slenderman standing right behind you then maybe you will survive, maybe you'll discover it's just a pile of clothes you threw on a chair last night and laugh about it. But _as_ Fiddlesticks you'll be working hard to ensure it's _always_ dark and the enemies mind is constantly filled with doubts. Keep them afraid to leave the safety of their towers until it's too late and they realise that as the fear grew within them they gave you power and now... nowhere is safe.
Will Surprise Party Fiddlesticks instill a sense of joy and jubilation among the enemy team when he appears out of nowhere bearing gifts of damage?
Absolutely.

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6ZtApyY6,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2020-01-28T20:15:40.419+0000)
>
> Absolutely.

dude i love you
<3

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6ZtApyY6,comment-id=00010002000000000000,timestamp=2020-02-01T00:45:24.975+0000)
>
> <3

You deleted his silence/ fear. 
50 bucks says you deleted it or made it less aggressive.
so, is {{champion:75}} the Mr. X of League?

Totally!

Then Master Yi is like Nemesis or something t_T

<3

This is perfect. I very much appreciate the answer, my dude! You have no idea how hyped I am for new Fiddle!
Thanks for the question. I really hope it meets your expectations :)

May I ask one?
Does Fiddle keep his Q "animatronic scream" in his Preatorian skin?

Any chance his passive now leaves a copy of himself behind while standing still?  Say, leaving up to 3 or 4 copies around the map?

Then when people run into a previously un-explored bush and see a copy of Fiddles, they get a small jump scare?  Even tacking on a very small fear akin to Shaco boxes and giving it fake health/attackable would make that an _awesome_ spooky passive.
There is a chance.

Oh boi, answering gameplay questions? :D

Does this mean we'll get to see him soon?

Given this description in his devblog

> Experienced Fiddlesticks players will wreak mental havoc on their victims as they question what is real and what is a terrifying effigy.

I'd say that he'll have an ability like that, placing fake scarecrows on the map, so that people won't be sure if its really him or just a replica.
Not sure if it'd cause a fear though, it sounds like the idea is simply to confuse the enemy with those and an automatic scare would give it away pretty fast(unless it plays the same animation as Fiddles fear).
I LOVE that you use other games as references. So many studios avoid talking about other games but for us it gives a good reference point to understand where the team is coming from.

If I didn't constantly surround myself with games and media I couldn't do my job. It's pretty easy to say there'd be no LoL without the games that came before it but I believe that's true of all games. We get inspired by the stuff we as people love and want to make our own 'experience cocktails' and share them with others. That's how I feel all art is and why I am so passionate about it. Zed isn't the first Ninja I've seen but maybe for some players he is, and he inspires them to come up with a dark brooding ninja in something that they make one day. Nothing about my work is cooler than the idea that as I was inspired someone may be inspired by our work!

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6ZtApyY6,comment-id=000100060000,timestamp=2020-02-01T00:51:09.428+0000)
>
> Nothing about my work is cooler than the idea that as I was inspired someone may be inspired by our work!

Well said! Thank you for the response, much appreciated.

TL;DR: 

- If I don't ward? Jumpscares.

- Hotel? Trivago.
For everything else, there MasterYi

> But _as_ Fiddlesticks you'll be working hard to ensure it's _always_ dark

{{item:3179}}{{champion:9}}

> [{quoted}](name=Larriet,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6ZtApyY6,comment-id=00010004,timestamp=2020-01-28T22:13:14.744+0000)
>

IM NOT ALONE IN THINKING THIS. 
We may be on to something after all :D

Hi, can you please inform about the time frame when we can see FiddleSticks live, or new information about it?
 Is this a year?  Is it a month?  Or is it a matter of days?  Atleast approximately!
 I apologize that perhaps this issue does not apply to your work.
 
 The fact is that if you know in a group on reddit I and people like me are over a thousand.  We are similar to those people who showed addiction and must be quenched.  Fiddlesticks is a very charismatic champion, very beloved and has a soul.  Yes, it consists of straw, but it is very dear to me and to many who love it.  Please accept my request not to fetch information, but just to reassure fans.

 Thanks you!  Hello from Russia!
It is this year. But that's as much as I can say.

Thank you so much))))

This is exactly the answer I was expecting
Considering that Fiddle was the first thing they talked about in the champion roadmap likely means that Fiddlesticks is our next big release, so I'd expect him to hit the live servers in march.

Do I smell a clone/decoy mechanic? Maybe having the ability with his passive to cause the audio of his ult or something to go off for a random player on the enemy team? I'm getting heavy Spectre vibes from DOTA 2 lol

> [{quoted}](name=Arashiiko,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6ZtApyY6,comment-id=0001000a,timestamp=2020-01-29T16:51:48.032+0000)

Sounds like Fiddlesticks is going to have an ability ive wanted on Junglers for a long time.
Destroying wards. 

Riot does like to use VGUs and champion releases to test new mechanics theyre putting on the other; I.e., Maybe Senna's Q targeting wards is a hint that Fiddlesticks has an ability to directly attack wards. Of course Umbral Glaive exists, but Fiddlesticks isnt going to build Lethality....

> [{quoted}](name=Kindlejack,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=6ZtApyY6,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2020-01-28T19:29:24.071+0000)

But _as_ Fiddlesticks you'll be working hard to ensure it's _always_ dark and the enemies mind is constantly filled with doubts. Keep them afraid to leave the safety of their towers until it's too late and they realise that as the fear grew within them they gave you power and now... nowhere is safe.

But...the real question is how are you going to keep the lights out and the floorboards creaking?  This unanswered question is the sort of thing that haunts my nights at the moment.  I am SO stoked and cannot wait to see Squad5's shambling horror hit the rift.  Fiddlesticks release info can't come soon enough.  Honestly, I just want to know if the not too subtle choices of words I have been observing and the little Easter egg I think I caught in the video of his ult are what I think they are.... or hopefully worse.

Please give all our best to Squad5 and here's hoping your nightmares aren't quite so vivid after you let Fiddlesticks loose on the rest of us!

-Tarcathos

sounds like any champion now a days. whoever gets the jump on you instantly blows you up and if you get the jump on them they die, lol.

:( The fear aspect is okay but the surprising people giving you the upper hand in fights is not the way. Exactly what i didn't want in my opinion. He is already useless in team fights, and getting hit my a cc while casting ult or after it is cast you pretty much die if you don't have zhoynas. He is the most team dependent heavy damage character in my opinion. Khazix can make a pick on an adc that steps up too far and kill them,and make it out because his mobility in teamfights. Rengar had quite a bit sustain and very high mobility. Ekko is the same way. All these are safer better options. Syndra jg is better than fiddle rn.  This turns him into another shaco, ok early game cheese and damage output, but really needs items to get anywhere.

My guess would be jumpscare.

They are keeping his ult, which already has the jumpscare effect if he unexpectedly blinks over a wall onto you for murder.
Also they said that they want to resolve his gameplay around "you have to find the scarecrow before it finds you". 

So I guess Fiddlesticks gets some power if he manages to stay hidden for some time and then he will jump onto you out of nowhere and make you wet your pants.
Ahhh, you don't know the fear of being low hp and you heart Pyke's W sound
Sad Nocturne noises :(
